ygData.subject: New! Improved! Cantera for Windows
ygData.msgSnippet: There is a new, much-improved version of the Cantera 1.2 distribution for Windows. It is currently configured only for building Fortran applications, but now

There is a new, much-improved version of the Cantera 1.2 distribution 
for Windows. It is currently configured only for building Fortran 
applications, but now does not require you to have Visual C++. 

See http://www.cantera.org/howto/getting_started.htm for details on 
how to install Cantera and build Fortran applications with Compaq 
Visual Fortran. The process is now very simple and you should be up 
and running in less than a couple of minutes.

It comes with an executable program that does zero-D kinetics, which 
requires no programming at all. Look in the "Cantera Examples" folder 
on the desktop, go to the zero-D kinetics folder, and double click 
zero.exe. It should run a hydrogen/oxygen ignition simulation using 
GRI-Mech 3.0, and produce an Excel-readable CSV file with the 
results. You can also use your own mechanisms. More example programs 
will be added soon.

The Cantera Fortran manual is also included in the distribution.
